page.title: 06TREDINGTON CHURCH
page.content:
It is often said that there is a tombstone in{Tredington Churchyard with the words below. There might have been in the past, for a good many of the old stones were removed many years ago. "Dirty Tredington, wooden steeple Funny parson, wicked people" Another version has as the second line ..."wicked parson, funny people"
The present{wooden tower at Tredington (which looks as though it belongs to the Tudor era) was built in 1936. This replaced one, built in 1902 in the same style, which had collapsed. Before that time the wooden tower (hardly deserves the word steeple, though it has a weathercock on it) was an ordinary square affair as seen on paintings in the church.
